intro: Zaluzianskya tropicalis, commonly known as the tropical zonal flower, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for tropical gardens and container planting.
